p: We examined whether our potential biomarkers were associated with MCI status. For the PD group ( Table 3), of the five inflammatory markers considered, levels of CRP and IL-6 were significantly raised ( p-values 0.015 and 0.003, respectively) in PD-MCI cases compared to those without cognitive impairment, and the composite inflammatory score of PD-MCI participants at baseline was significantly higher ( p = 0.006) ( Table 3). We found p21 expression levels also higher in cognitively normal participants than in those with PD-MCI at baseline ( p = 0.012). No significant difference was found for telomere length or p16 expression in relation to PD-MCI ( Table 3). In the case of participants from the control group, the presence of MCI did not result in significantly different levels of any of the senescence or inflammatory biomarkers (data not shown).
